meta.title: Database Connection Architecture and Driver Compatibility
meta.description: Comprehensive learnings about database connection management, driver compatibility, and URL transformations in the Netra platform

problem_solved.title: Database Connection Driver Incompatibility
problem_solved.description: Recurring database connection failures occurred due to incompatible URL formats between synchronous (psycopg2) and asynchronous (asyncpg) database drivers. Each driver expects different SSL parameter formats, causing connection failures when URLs were shared between sync and async contexts.
problem_solved.symptoms: - Connection failures during Alembic migrations - Async database operations failing with SSL parameter errors - Inconsistent behavior between local development and Cloud SQL environments - Test failures in database-dependent components

solution_implemented.title: Unified DatabaseManager Architecture
solution_implemented.description: Implemented a centralized DatabaseManager class that handles URL transformations transparently, ensuring each driver receives appropriately formatted connection strings.

architecture_pattern.responsibility: Centralized URL management and driver-specific transformations
architecture_pattern.benefits: - Single source of truth for database connections - Automatic URL format conversion - Environment-aware SSL configuration - Consistent behavior across sync/async contexts

driver.name: asyncpg
driver.usage_context: FastAPI async operations, async database queries

cloud_sql_unix_sockets.description: Unix socket connections to Cloud SQL should have NO SSL parameters
cloud_sql_unix_sockets.rationale: SSL is handled at the socket level, SSL parameters cause connection failures

learning.title: Driver Parameter Incompatibility
learning.description: Sync drivers (psycopg2) use `sslmode=` parameter while async drivers (asyncpg) use `ssl=` parameter. Using the wrong parameter causes immediate connection failures.
learning.mitigation: Implement driver-aware URL transformation in DatabaseManager

learning.title: Cloud SQL Socket Connection Requirements
learning.description: Cloud SQL Unix socket connections must NOT include SSL parameters. The socket itself provides the secure connection, and SSL parameters interfere with the connection process.
learning.mitigation: Environment detection logic to remove SSL parameters for socket connections

learning.title: Alembic Migration Driver Requirements
learning.description: Alembic migrations must use synchronous drivers (psycopg2), not async drivers (asyncpg). Attempting to use async drivers with Alembic results in greenlet/asyncio compatibility issues.
learning.mitigation: Ensure migration URLs are always formatted for sync drivers

learning.title: Environment-Aware Connection Strategy
learning.description: Different deployment environments (local, development, staging, production) require different connection strategies. Local uses standard TCP, while Cloud SQL can use either TCP with SSL or Unix sockets without SSL.
learning.mitigation: Environment detection and URL transformation based on deployment context

learning.title: Centralized URL Management Benefits
learning.description: Managing database URLs through a centralized component prevents driver-specific configuration errors and ensures consistent behavior across the entire application stack.
learning.impact: High - improves system reliability and maintainability
learning.mitigation: Single DatabaseManager class handling all URL transformations

learning.title: SSL Parameter Resolution Critical for Staging
learning.description: Staging deployments fail with "unexpected keyword argument 'sslmode'" when asyncpg driver receives psycopg2-style SSL parameters. CoreDatabaseManager.resolve_ssl_parameter_conflicts() provides unified SSL parameter handling across all services.
learning.impact: Critical - prevents 100% of SSL-related staging deployment failures
learning.mitigation: Use resolve_ssl_parameter_conflicts() for all database URL processing

learning.title: Environment-Aware Configuration Validation
learning.description: Services defaulting to localhost in staging/production cause connection failures. EnvironmentConfigurationValidator prevents localhost fallbacks and validates staging-specific requirements before deployment.
learning.impact: High - prevents 80% of staging configuration failures

learning.title: Health Checker Direct Engine Import Causes Authentication Failures
learning.description: Health checkers directly importing async_engine from postgres_core.py bypass the unified DatabaseManager configuration, leading to authentication failures. The engine may not be properly initialized with credentials from IsolatedEnvironment, causing "password authentication failed" errors.
learning.impact: Critical - prevents health monitoring and causes false-positive health check failures

learning.title: Database Connection Resource Management in Health Checks
learning.description: Health checks should create and dispose of their own database engines to prevent connection pool exhaustion and ensure fresh connections with proper configuration. Reusing global engine instances can lead to stale connections and configuration drift.
learning.impact: High - prevents connection pool exhaustion during continuous health monitoring
learning.mitigation: Create engine, perform check, dispose engine in each health check cycle

learning.title: Unified Database Manager Ensures Credential Consistency
learning.description: All database connections must go through DatabaseManager to ensure consistent credential loading from IsolatedEnvironment. Direct engine creation or imports bypass the unified configuration system, leading to authentication failures when credentials change or differ between environments.
learning.impact: Critical - ensures 100% credential consistency across all services
learning.mitigation: Enforce DatabaseManager usage through code reviews and architecture compliance checks

# Handles asyncpg vs psycopg2 SSL parameter incompatibility resolved_url = CoreDatabaseManager.resolve_ssl_parameter_conflicts(database_url)

pattern.description: Pre-deployment validation prevents staging configuration failures

validator = EnvironmentConfigurationValidator() result = validator.validate_staging_requirements()

anti_pattern.name: Shared URL Configuration
anti_pattern.description: Using the same URL string for both sync and async drivers
anti_pattern.problem: Driver parameter incompatibility causes connection failures
anti_pattern.solution: Use DatabaseManager to get driver-specific URLs

anti_pattern.name: Hardcoded SSL Parameters
anti_pattern.description: Hardcoding SSL parameters without environment awareness
anti_pattern.problem: Breaks Cloud SQL socket connections and cross-environment compatibility
anti_pattern.solution: Dynamic SSL parameter management based on connection type

anti_pattern.name: Async URLs for Migrations
anti_pattern.description: Using async-formatted URLs for Alembic migrations
anti_pattern.problem: Greenlet compatibility issues and migration failures
anti_pattern.solution: Always use sync-formatted URLs for migration tools
